Description of change
The way to implement this feature is to use a plugin called react-beautiful-dnd. Basically, put the MUI List inside a Droppable and wrap each MUI ListItem by a Draggable.
What's more important is updating the order indexes of facets when a drag and drop is triggered. Please see code comments for more details.
Also, this PR ensures order indexes are properly updated when a facet is deleted.
Please note that a warning will be given in the Jest test caused by react-beautiful-dnd.  There are discussions around it (atlassian/react-beautiful-dnd#1593) . This issue may be a bug of this plugin.

commit.message: Implement the functionality of reordering facets.

Make sure the Jest test of FacetedSearchSettingsPage works properly with
the reordering feature.

The recommended solution I found is to use ListItemIcon for icons instead of ListItemSecondaryAction.

nodes.bodyText: Must've missed this previously. Isn't the spread operator here redundant?

I thought endIndex was meant to be the new index, so why isn't this simply:
draggedFacet.orderIndex = endIndex

?

I do again wonder if this could simply be done with a map and then filter. i.e. map through and update the flag of the specified facet - maybe new facets (i.e. not persisted on server) should have a local ID (e.g. new1, new2, new3) - to be deleted: true; and then filter through and remove and deleted facets that only have a local ID.
Note: Mapping again would be with the spread operator to create new instances and a new array.
hmmm, see if you did have a local only id like mentioned above (e.g. new1, new2, etc) then this would also be simpler.
This is a great candidate to have its own unit test in something like FacetSearchSettingsModule.test.ts.
Hmmm, I kind of like that this function is over here - especially as it knows nothing of state etc. However, I do wonder if this is here, should the delete be over here too. Dunno. 🤔

commit.message:
Simplify the function 'reorder', including:

1. Using 'map' to loop through the list of facets and update facets;
2. Removing the use of lodash.

Move the function of deleting a facet to module and simplify its logic.

Sort facets based on their order indexes before they get rendered.

In the Jest test of FacetedSearchSettings, add tests for functions 'reorder'
and 'removeFacetFromList'.
